author: anmenaga
body:
The expectation is that experimental features should be enabled by default on **Preview** releases.
That is done by adding `ExperimentalFeatures` section to `powershell.config.json` that is part of the released package.
Some released **Preview** packages have either `ExperimentalFeatures` section missing or the `powershell.config.json` file missing, resulting in experimental features being disabled by default on some **Preview** packages. Please see the list below.

## Steps to reproduce

1) download **Preview** package, extract it
2) `powershell.config.json` should exist
3) `powershell.config.json` should contain `ExperimentalFeatures` section

## Actual behavior
This list was composed by checking only `7.1.0-preview*` packages that are `*.zip` and `*.tar.gz`
```none
VERBOSE: PowerShell-7.1.0-preview.1-win-arm32.zip - ExperimentalFeatures not specified in powershell.config.json
VERBOSE: PowerShell-7.1.0-preview.1-win-arm64.zip - ExperimentalFeatures not specified in powershell.config.json
```

comments.body: @daxian-dbw @anmenaga Please use `Backport-*` labels instead of milestone.

title: Experimental features are disabled by default on some Preview packages
